casebody.data:
FRANK WOLKOWSKY. as Administrator of the Estate of A. Wol-kowsky, Deceased, v. DAVID A. GOODKIND. 19 So. (2nd) 106

June Term, 1944

August 1, 1944 En Bane Rehearing denied September 15, 1944 Redfearn & Ferrell, for petitioner. W. G. Price, for respondent. PER CURIAM:

Certiorari denied.

BROWN, CHAPMAN, THOMAS and SEBRING, JJ., concur. BUFORD, C. J., and TERRELL, J., dissent. ADAMS, J., not participating. BUFORD, C. J.,

dissenting:

It appears to me that the sustaining of demurrer to amended pleas 4 and 5 and the denial of leave to file proffered *785additional pleas, alleging fraud and coercion, constituted error for which judgment should have been reversed on appeal to circuit court; that affirmance of judgment by circuit court constituted a departure from the essential requirements of the law. Therefore, certiorari should be granted.

TERRELL, J., concurs.
